meanings.definition: The act of consigning or delivering something for preservation or safekeeping.
meanings.sent1: She completed the consignations of the valuable documents to the bank vault.
meanings.sent2: The consignations of old family heirlooms were entrusted to the museum for safekeeping.
meanings.sent3: The consignations of cookies to the hungry children disappeared in record time.
meanings.sent4: Her consignations of secrets to her best friend were always kept safe and secure.
meanings.sent5: The consignations of precious jewels sparkled in the dimly lit room.

meanings.definition: Goods or merchandise entrusted to someone for sale or safekeeping.
meanings.sent1: The consignations of handmade crafts were displayed beautifully in the shop window.
meanings.sent2: He received a shipment of consignations from various suppliers for the upcoming sale.
meanings.sent3: The consignations of toys brought joy to the children at the orphanage.
meanings.sent4: Her consignations of vintage clothing were a hit at the local flea market.
meanings.sent5: The consignations of fresh produce filled the shelves of the neighborhood grocery store.
